other_tests.findings: Compound heterozygous mutations H441Y and R459L confirmed Vitamin D-dependent rickets type 1 (VDDR-1).
Hypocalcemia (7.9 mg/dl), secondary hyperparathyroidism (PTH 580 pg/ml), alkaline phosphatase (741 U/l) and inappropriate normal 1,25OHD level (46 pg/ml).
Low serum calcium levels that improved with formula feeding, then showed acute hypocalcemia (6.4 mg/dl) with normal 1,25OHD level (25 pg/ml).
Hypocalcemia corrected within days; alkaline phosphatase increased due to hungry bone syndrome.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Within three months, PTH and alkaline phosphatase elevations resolved; skeletal healing observed in sibling 1 after five weeks.

other_tests.findings: Severe loss of activity in CYP27B1 due to mutations H441Y and R459L.
